column2: Feels like being in France or Italy. Very tasty (light) food and perfect coffee. Just relax and listen to the music from the 1920th while enjoying your break.
This was the cutest cafe! Breakfast sandwiches & coffee were amazing! But the owner behind the counter making the magic happen- made the experience exceptional! What a gem! Highly recommend!
Cute cafe in the neighborhood. Friendly owner and great foods. Lovely experience -- would highly recommend!

Everything tasted good but there was one person working at 10am on a Sunday and we waited forever for our food even though it wasn’t busy, need more than 1 person taking ordering a, making coffee and cooking breakfast.

Whole in the wall with a limited menu full of delicious dishes. I'd recommend this place to anyone. I had the Mediterranean Frittata with smoked salmon. It was a great frittata. I also had a $7 mamosa! Very well priced drink. Also, can't rave more about the music that took you out of San Francisco and to France just sitting in a cafe people watching.

A necessary stop anytime my girlfriend and I are in the area. Two bagels, two coffees and two chocolate donuts. Everything is always delicious and the owner always a delight. Forget the areas more corporate spots, come here instead. Don't forget to tip 💸

Nice place for breakfast, wouldn’t call it a super high end place. The place was popular amongst locals but they wasn’t all too appealing for first timers. I think is a place you would go to if you lived in the area for some time and just need a regularly priced coffee.
Beautiful restaurant with the best lox bagel I have ever had. The place all in all is exquisite from the service to atmosphere to the food.
Sat outside for breakfast. Got lunch to go for a picnic on the north side of the bridge after our walk across the bridge. Sandwiches were good too.
The food here is pretty great and their prices are pretty cheap too. I will recommend eating the food here whenever you have a chance.
Loved the ambiance and neighborhood.  People were really nice!  Food was good but not amazing.  Coffee was great.  Crab and sherry soup of the day was excellent.
Great little cafe! Had some great sandwiches here. Staff seemed really lovely and very welcoming.
Just the best Francisco Bagels. Friendly service. Can’t recommend highly enough. Great local place to stop.
Really great coffee and sandwiches!

Just cafe, nothing special. You can also get meal at here. Many tables at inside. When I sat, the table was dirty and sticky. I odered single iced coffee and single mocha. The iced cofffee came in large cup. Taste was not good. Just soso. It was too light coffee. Mocha was not bad.  I think if you find the quite cafe around fisherman's wharf, here is good choice.
Cute cafe in the neighborhood. Very warm, friendly folks and amazing coffee. Must visit!

Very bad experience  We’re here with my kids, ordered Cesar with chicken and tuna sandwich.  Hygiene not recommended- salad were old and rotten, didn’t get washed, bread burned, chef did not change gloves between al his doing..  Can not recommend!!  One star - got my money back - no question asked.
Went here for lunch today and loved it! I had the Francisco Bagel and highly recommend
Excellent coffee, excellent vibes. They also have food!
Fresh and delicious! The owner is so kind and the service is very friendly.
I came here months ago during a trip and still remember it because the guy behind the counter was very kind and offered good suggestions on what to have.
Great local place with good food and espresso. I highly recommend stopping here.

My local cafe and I enjoy everything about it. The owner is very nice and makes you feel apart of the community. The coffee and the food is amazing. Also great ambiance, never that crowded and can be a great place to chill or get work done. 10/10
Good breakfast and espresso. Barista who made our drinks wasn't very friendly, but the other girl who took our order was. Overall, good place to come too.
Really nice sandwich and great price. Quite and quick in the afternoon. Lots of options on the menu. Seasoned well.

Great quite and chill place to have a beer and relax! The waiter is really polite and helpful! The Italian classic music in the back adds a note of love and peace to the place! I’ll definitely come back!

Rude and borderline dangerous owner. I put the umbrella up on one of their outdoor seats but it broke because of the wind and almost fell on my head. The owner came out and started yelling at me because he blamed me for breaking it. I told him that he needed to calm down but he started cussing at me and got in my face like he was about to punch me. The other guests were shocked also. I think his English wasn't good so he might have gotten confused at the situation but it doesn't excuse his dangerous and unprofessional behavior. Avoid this coffee shop, there are plenty of other good places in San Francisco

The owner is the barista. He works Wednesday through Sunday and is closed Monday and Tuesday. He's very friendly and lots of locals frequent this location because of the atmosphere. The coffee is amazing.  Because he works by himself, if there is a lot of people, it can take a little bit of time to get your order. But he is so kind and everyone is so friendly that no one seems bothered by a few extra minutes. People keep coming back and so do I  :)
So so. I don’t think the clerks clear the tables frequently since the tables are sticky with sugar and somethings.
Small but personal touch taste. Mediterranean plate is superb. Overall Nice and Clean

Nice place for a quick stop in for a cup of your favorite espresso, or a bagel on the go. The food was good, but very basic. I ordered the Frittata, which i assume was made right on the spot. As it consisted of crackes whole eggs, not scrambled with onion tossed in. A little on the bland side, but the salmon on top helped. My friend ordered the bagel with lox, but forgot his lox. The food was not terrible, but simple. I take it easy on the guy as he was the only one working. The coffee was good, but like I said, expect simple and quick.
Friendly and unpretentious local cafe. I had a latte here, which turned out to be pretty decent.

A group of friends went yesterday. I arrived with another friend a bit later and ask for permission to go to the restroom and it was denied since it was clean. No apologies, as if going to the toilet was a choice instead a basic need. Very disappointed.

Stumbled upon this lovely corner cafe while I was trekking somewhat frenetically around San Fran in attempt to see the city while here on business. I had the Greek Salad and a glass Italian wine... and they kindly showed me where I could charge my thoroughly dead phone. Gracious, warm service. Food was great! Atmosphere authentic and delightful!
I didn’t like the breakfast bagel .. Didn't like the whole experience ..  Not recommended at all ..

I had the delicious Francisco bagel to go with capers, tomato, red onion and a generous amount of delicious cream cheese all on a toasted, crunchy, chewy, perfectly done seeded bagel. Hold the lox. Looking forward to having a leisurely brunch here once I feel safe enough to do so, as it looks like a nice place to people watch (and there's some really cool art on the walls!). Great service, friendly people, fresh and flavorful food.
Mediocre food that's vastly overpriced. And onion bagels with jam and butter are just wrong, especially for breakfast. All disposable plates etc also bad. Shop itself is pretty.

We came here for coffee last week because we decided to spend some time here. We love to have a chit-chat over a cup of coffee. We picked this location because it's one of the best places to grab a java. I just think the chocolate overwhelms the coffee that you may think you're drinking hot chocolate. It's worth trying!
Loved the ambiance and neighborhood.  People were really nice!  Food was good but not amazing.  Coffee was great.  Crab and sherry soup of the day was excellent.

Nice coffee shop with nice staff. My friend eats there daily and the salads look amazing. Lots of outdoor seating and indoor seating. A relaxed gem in in the neighborhood. Enjoy some good food and coffee drinks. Also you will meet a mix of locals and tourist. Its great. You will not regret it!!

The food was freshly prepared so you wait just a bit, but it's well worth it. Place had a nice neighbourhood "buzz" and feel about it. It is handy for the Mason-Powell turnaround stop and, as well as breakfast, does lunch and dinner with a happy hour from 2.00pm - 6.00pm. Staff were ultra-friendly and helpful.

Friendly local spot with outdoor seating. Would be nice to see more plant-based options on the menu. I can't give 5 stars to anywhere offering single-use plastics and non recyclable coffee cups though.
Cute spot. Awesome staff. Had a falafel sandwich that hit the spot. Bright and airy.

Glad others had a good experience here, but we did not. Chicken on my salad was about an hour past its prime. Server was clueless about any kind of welcoming attitude. My dad witnessed someone behind the counter dropping food on the floor and then putting it back on the counter rather than in the trash. Good general atmosphere, and I'd go here for a coffee, but I would not eat food they prepared again. 1.5 stars.
Their coffee and sandwich were great but the back area was dirty and the toilet itself was in a bad state. Friendly people though.

My son and I love getting sandwiches here when we come into the city. An unassuming and charming little lunch spot with a delightful staff that has always been super friendly to my 6yo. The food is very good and the prices aren't astronomical. And it's only 3 blocks away from the more touristy Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf.
I come here for lunch once a week, always super friendly, I always get the Francisco Bagel with Lox and The San Fran sandwich. Really nice spot to sit outside in the sun and eat.

I always LOVE going to this caffe. I got to know it well when I lived around the corner from it. For 10+ years. The espresso and the food are great. Ambience is wonderful. And near many key locations I need. I don't drive these days due to past major illnesses. And happily walk around for many errands as well as great sights.

I really can't rate this place low enough. Felt unwelcome right from the start when the waitress looked as though she would really rather not have to bother. The whole experience though was truly tarnished by losing my wallet, 10 minutes after leaving I realised and called the cafe only to be left holding and then have the phone put down on me. When I returned they couldn't have done any less to help. Shocking customer service but what grates even more is to see such a lack of support for someone (a customer!) who has a problem. Don't go there!

Live in the neighborhood and have been coming for the last 10 years. Most of the time just to grab a sandwich or coffee and go. Staff is super friendly, love the lox bagel. I think they could do a bit more with the place since it has high ceilings, outdoor seating and some cool booths inside.
This is the best cafe food and drink i’ve had in san francisco. Lived here about a year. Owner is beyond friendly. Great place to grab food, read, meet with friends, etc.

Good food and nice little spot but the lady who served us didn't give us a great service. We ordered and paid and then the  waitress told us we have 30minutes to eat and drink as they closing the store...also our table was dirty and stocky and we had to beg to get it cleaned! Shame as the food manu is delicious and the food actually tasted amazing!

The food at Cafe Francisco is good, though not great.  The service is good, though not great.  The atmosphere/environment is good, though not great.  I think you get the point.  Cafe Francisco is a small venue with some character.  I'd suggest to grab a booth for you and your date, or just sit at a table outside if you can.

I wasn't sure what to order and asked advices to the waitress. She said in spanish "Que pesada" which means "so annoying" to her co-worker, thinking I wouldn't understand. I decided to not tip at the counter, she showed immediately the receipt to the chef. The salad was awful, didn't cut any of the bacon, cheese or veggies because I didn't tip. Never seen such little respect. I do not recommend this place.
Amazing coffee and food. The service was top notch and the location is prime for getting work done or just enjoying the bustle of the city. Would recommend
Great restaurant with amazing food!! I always visit when I come from out of state!

So i was eating my bagel when this man (who seemed to be autistic, but that's besides the point) walked in asking for free water. The man behind the counter was kind enough to give him water and a piece of bread! Based off this one instance, I can conclude the service is top-notch!!!
Nice local place. Great coffee and small Italian bistro with great atmosphere and people. I guess dog friendly even though I think that's a little nasty....but whatever floats your boat.

The staff were rude. Firstly I asked if I could go sit outside but wasn't advised I'd have to come back in to get my order. Secondly I ordered a cafe latte, was given a chai latte and when I asked for it to be re-made the server refused to accept she had heard wrong, although did make a new drink (which was then so hot I burnt my tongue)
The food is good but very expensive. Everything you eat from is disposable, but the staff is very nice
Excellent caprese salad (with basil leaves and capers) and decent turkey sandwiches. Good spot for young kids. Only minor issue is that the bottled beer isn't ice cold.

The service seems to really hate their jobs here. The carafe of coffee was barely warm. When asking what the sample was they had out, the lady responded "bread". It was a lemon poundcake. Overall, it was meh. Didn't bother getting food. Not gonna come back.

I stood there for 20 minutes without being acknowledged while the lone employee got people's sandwich orders wrong. Couldn't get a cup of coffee in that time, having been front of the line since arriving.  This fella must not be serious.
Really liked this place. We grabbed a bagel and latte. Nice to sit outside in a good neighbourhood or inside as well. Toilet is a bit weird located next to the kitchen.
My autistic son, P A U L, walked in with a condom on his head and a bomb in his lunchbox.  The manager still served him free water and a free piece of bread.  Outstanding service. 5/5
Great small cafe. Reasonable prices and welcoming owner.

My friend was a little parched and went in for a small cup of water. The very polite and kind owner decided to not only give him a cup of water and straw but also a small slice of bread. Great Service Cx
It's good.  Really small place but the food and coffee is good.
Guess what New York City, you’re not the only one with good pastrami. This place is amazing good pastrami
Nice little cafe with good coffee and friendly service. A good place to work, you can ask for the WiFi password. Not to crowded, light music. You can also sit outside.
Had coffee and Mediterranean Frittata here. Coffee taste like hot milk, couldn't drink more than 2 sips of it. Breakfast was alright for the price
Had brunch for four and it was very good. Indoor and outside seating but a bit tight. Food was hot and tasty and prices were reasonable. Great corner location.
Owner was very nice and kind to me and my autistic brother Cx. Not only did he give us water but also delicious italian bread. Thank you kind sir.
Always friendly service, good food & espresso, and wonderful atmosphere inside and out
This is the worst place ever! They let you wait half an hour in the line and another half hour or more for the food. Very grumpy man as well. Should hire some more staff to get things going.

I work near Pier 39 and face severely limited lunch options. A coworker introduced me to this spot and it's great for a quick lunch if you're in the neighborhood. There are lots of reasonably priced options from sandwiches to salads to mediterranean food. The Greek plate I had was awesome - plenty of pita for my hummus (always something restaurants never seem to give you enough of), falafel, great greek salad, and dolmas. All of that for less than $8, thumbs up to Cafe Francisco!

Great North Beach secret just steps off the tourist beaten Wharf path.  Vintage setting with consistent cool beats piped outside as well.  Several mouth watering frittatas to choose from at a reasonable price in the morning.  Sip wine during happy hour every day from 4pm-7pm.  The art curator always has original work on display from local photographers and painters.  Very family-feel here - I always feel welcome -- fast wi-fi and a nice second office.
Hell ya. Great bagel. Great morning solitude.
Came in to the store and the guy behind the counter was AWESOME! Really polite and courteous encounter and would love to come again. I would recommend Cafe Francisco to all of my friends!

I was sitting and enjoying my delicious coffee and bread when (what seemed like) an autistic man and his vato came in. They were homeless people asking for a drink and bread. The generous owner gave him a cup of water and slice of bread. P A U L  D E N I N O  cx
Great local shop, owner was in house and very much enjoyed chatting with him. Good sandwiches and happy hour wine vibes 🥂 …
Great place. A homeless man walked in and asked for water and they gave him water AND FREE BREAD. So nice
Unfriendly and incompetent service. Ordered a simple item to go - requested NOT to add bacon. Came home, opened the box - it's full of bacon.
Amazing place, class act! A homeless man walked into the cafe and asked for a glass of water and some bread, they provided the bread and water to him without asking a single question.

Got to love Cafe Francisco, outdoor seating,fresh fresh fresh.... quality breakfast great variety of salads sandwiches  and happy hour in the sun, great music and selection of beer and wine, yes that's what's mama recommended.
Lovely lady serving and a nice traditional setting but the coffee was really disappointing. Very weak and the latte didn’t differ from the flat white in any way
Very bad experience. تجربة سيئة جدا. The workers are arrogant and the service is very ugly.

Amazing place amazing staff one man in particular gave my friend a piece of bread and a cup of water to help him . He sees a homeless person and instead of judging he helps them amazing place i recommend it .
I love this place and visit as often as i can. It is cool vintage cafe with local artists and nice people. Food is delicious and not expensive.
Owner was very nice to my friend with disabilities. Hooked him up with a free slice of bread and cup of cold water. 5/5
great place , good vibes, perfect cute local touch from san Francisco, great fresh food and the owner and Jasmin are very very friendly and nice people . definitely coming back.
Great food, but also just a lovely place to sit down and get away from it all. You could close your eyes and imagine you're on vacation.
This little place we stumbled upon on our morning walk and ended up with an AMAZING breakfast!! There was no wait, pleasant service and excellent food!
Defenitely has the best bread in Town. Me and my friend Cx love it! Owner is always happy and really loves the people in San Francisco.
VERY great place. The guy was such a nice person and even gave complimentary bread which was top notch Cx
Rating low because i didn't enjoy my coffee. Either it's normal there or happened to us, it tasted just milk considering I only like strong coffee.
Overall great food. The only bummer is sometimes the staff are a little unfriendly. Its in a great location and food is easy to get togo.
Terrible service, didn’t show any respect to us. The salad was terrible, no seasoning, tons of spinach and 4 Pieces of bacon on top. Waste of money... Do not go there
Nice ambiance and neighborhood! Really enjoyed the coffee offerings and appetizers (at happy hour price)!
Outstanding establishment for breakfast. Friendly employees, very cool decor and delicious breakfast and specialty coffee. Loved this place!
Great neighborhood place.  Could use better coffee but the folks are really nice and the food is pretty decent
The owner is such a nice guy :) excellent service, I would go there again anytime. Best cafe in SF.
Excellent! We're coming back tomorrow. Great coffee, great food. Recommend the iced chai, and Le croissant.
Cappachino was below average but the service was good. I did not try the food, so I'll likely come back to see if the food is with the visit.
Came in with my friend Tyrone, we are both homeless, the owner offered us free water and bread, thank you so much friend, god bless
Employees actually have a heart to the homeless swarming the streets. Great staff and great food for a low low price!
Charming and warm atmosphere along with excellent service. This cafe is a neighborhood gem.
An autistic homeless came in this café to ask for water. The man working there give him the water and free bread 5 star!!!
Friendly bar, good wine at 5$ between 4pm and 7 pm, tasty Greek salad, quiet location.
Great coffee. Excellent vibe. A real gem.
Very nice place. The staff are friendly and WiFi is very fast. The coffee tastes very good.
Frittata and bagel has been good, service was medium. Nice place to hang out.
Excellent food and happy hour beers! Awesome Prosciutto plate and Lobster Sherry Bisque.
The staff wasn’t really nice but the bagel and the coffee was good. Not very accessible with a stroller.
Super friendly owner/staff. Coffee and food is fantastic.
Happy hour in the evening, nice place to sit and drink a cold beer. Food looks great too.
Very nice workers, gave a homeless man some water and bread. Amazing service.
Good breakfast good wifi haven't tried drinks yet but I definitely will do so
Great coffee! Great breakfast, juices, options! Nice service and SF atmosphere. Fast internet!
Very few places where Americano is actually good. Great little cafe!
Understaffed. So, don't go there if you're in a hurry. Great place to eat outdoors on a nice day.
Food is great.  Had lunch one day and a small breakfast the next.
Lovely old cafe with lots of character. Great pastries and coffee too!
Very fun little place. Unassuming, felt truly local, and everything was very fairly priced.
Super nice guy at the register, really clean, hooked me up with a free water when I was down on my luck
Soooooooo baaaaad Soooooooo ugly Soooooooo weak Soooooooo inappropriate Soooooooo uncomfortable
came in dehydrated and got free cup of water & bread from owner, extremely nice people & good atmosphere! <3
Excellent sandwich but very poor service (from woman cashier, bored, blase, rude, with an attitude...not sure which one), and processed orange juice sold as fresh squeezed juice.
Very nice and calm place, perfect for a relaxing drink after a visit to Pier 39. Huge selection of drinks.
Great restaurant. Didn't have any scuffed moose meat though Cx
Great place to stop in and have a mimosa or coffee.  Bagels are outstanding!
Such a cool little place. They make a great Latte!!
Great place to hangout in the morning. I like their Breakfast Bagel with sausage and egg.
Love this place so much. It has become a staple in my morning routine
Charming cafeteria in a quiet neighborhood.
One of the nicest owners I have ever met. Wasn't racist to my BLACK friend
Great breakfast/brunch spot. Tasty bagels and prosciutto.
Gave my homeless friend a nice array of free items. Come here if you're hungry!
My son Paul went in there for a glass of water and some fried chicken, and he came out a changed man.  Regards,  Enza
Delicious Francisco bagel & cappuccino! Relaxing and friendly atmosphere.
Delicious food. Good vegetarian options. Nice location.
Try the Mediterranean frittata is amazing! Very friendly service!
Nice, cozy coffee shop, friendly staff, great selection.
A nice Cafe. Serves great breakfast coffee and sandwiches. Very nice location.
Very generous staff, would recommend visiting this cafe while you are near San Francisco. TriHards in the chat
Good coffee, good bagels, great music
Great spot to sit outside. Tasty food + they serve alcohol ☺️
Good place for a quick lunch. Not crowded and good food.
Great coffee and the atmosphere is good to grab a book and sit for hours
The owner is such a cool guy and the place is the best around for a coffee!
Lovely ladies with good coffee, not a tourist spot thankfully :-)
Tables are sticky and the place smells bad. Employees are nice, though.
Hooked up my daddy Paul  with some water and a loaf of bread! Cafe Francisco has the friendliest staff!
Good food but very stick tables. Be cleaner please!
Helped my friend out with free food, when he was homeless! Great service recommended!
Food is not fresh.  Kitchen looks disgusting.  Have had one too many bad experiences.
Some of the nicest people I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. 10/10 service.
Owner is a genuinely nice guy. Good food, good vibes.
Love how they know my order, keep up the good work !
Helped my autistic friend with some free water and bread. Would recommend this cafe
Great place! Super nice employees, very generous.
Try the time salad.  It's delightful and pairs well with the. Mimosa.
This place is never open. I’ve tried several times
Very nice workers. They gave a homeless man free food
Great service, This Cafe is making the world a better place.
Friendly staff good selection of sandwiches and reasonable price
Decent food and prices but got stuck waiting 45 minutes for a to go bagel on a Sunday mid morning.
Great coffee! Great frittatas! Coffee knowledgeable friendly staff.
Worn down, but gets a higher grading for friendly staff and nice food, served in good size portions.
Gave my boy ice bread and water. Papa Bless. Nice Guy. 5/5
Best employees, best owner, deserves every single 5/5 review that comes their way
Nice, cheap little cafe. Great to get out of the rain.
Very chill place with a nice range of sandwiches and decent coffee.
Generous portions and acceptable coffee. Nice little neighbourhood cafe
Very good coffee, worth the walk past several starbucks.
Fed my autistic niece Paula Denisa with the utmost respect. Cx. Would take her there again.
Some autistic homeless guy came in, and the nice guy gave him food and water
Nice little cafe with good food and coffee. Short walk from waterfront.
Very nice guy, and food was very tasty for a nice price!
Amazing place! The nicest staff and great options.
Quaint little coffee and breakfast eatery with great atmosphere.
Delicious food, good coffee and free Wi-Fi
Helped my homeless friend out with water, food and a great talk Cx
great local cafe happy hour made it...near bus stop
Treated my boy paul Denino real good 10/10 customer service Cx
Nice corner location.  Cheap happy hour drinks. Wifi and plenty of outlets.
If you have any taste, you’ll like this place.  #vibes
very nice man gave my homeless friend water and bread
OK, it's not a 5 start restaurant, but it's one of the most comfortable places to get a cup of coffee anywhere.
Great Food, Great service, Great drinks, great bathroom, great Cx in the chat
Very friendly staff and good food on top of that
Great location, great food, and polite staff
Such nice and lovely service <3 great place Cx
Great place, fantastic people, awesome food!
Nice cafe.  Great breakfast bagel.
Great place giving out food to the homeless!
nice to chill and meet friend, a lovely little cafe i don t hesitate to recommend
Awesome place, gives out free bread and water to the autistic
Great spot! Owner is incredibly nice and funny!
Really good sandwich and chill out feeling
Food was exceptional and service was great!
Best breakfast bagel in the city
Guy at the counter was so friendly and the bread was so yummy.
Great eats, service and ambiance
Great place he helped my man out.
11/10 Puts customer satisfaction over $$$ Cx
Nice relaxed place with simple food and wifi
Woke up, received free bread and water, 10/10 would finish tutorial island again
Cosy place with good food and excellent hot chocolate
Great little stop for a bagel and a mimosa ;)
Try the Mediterranean Frittata - so good!
Had a great time watching someone go here!!
Best Americano I think I've ever had.
Humid and stuffy inside. Nice outdoor seating.
Perfect place good food and cheap
Wonderful relaxing spot one job to another.
Amazing Place I love the kindness Cx
Food was good, but service bad
Great breakfast beagles, and good coffee
Nice terrace and the coffee was good.
Great spot, great food.
Very kind and welcoming employees.
Great lively area with excellent service
Very good in all they do
Excellent sandwich and good coffee
Awesome guy Cx , Jesus is the bread.
Gives out REALLY good free food
The owner Tris very Hard to accomadate his customers
Amazing service. Nice people.
Just what a coffee shop should be.
Great, generous place :D
Kind, and caring man working the cashier.
Red Pepper Gouda soup is TO DIE FOR!
Free bread and water! Awesome.
The San Fran sandwich is delicious!!
gave my trihard free bread and water
10$ for tiny plate. Disappointed!
Best employees ever. Cx
Very good customer service!
Owner incredibly kind !!!!!!!!!!!! GREATEST CAFE ALL DAY
Their Ice Poseidon sandwich is to die for.
Nice outdoor seating
Really nice to people in need.
Gave ice Poseidon free water and bread
Good and social service Cx
helped out my homeless boy ice
My favorite place
Good coffee and no pretense
Great service! Cx
Cute little coffee spot.
HOOK A BROTHA UP Cx
Caprese salad is the best
A decent size meal
Bad service, many flies
Good breakfast sandwiches
very friendly <3
good selection and coffee
Best cafe NA
great guy Cx
Fantastic place!
Amazing Bread!
Sandwiches are lit.
Amazing place!
Great place Cx
Great bread
cx
Great service
Amazing service
Nicest staff
Excellent
EXCELLENT service !
WAter is 10/10
P A U L D E N I N O Cx
Outstanding service
Awesome place
Satisfactory +
Fantastic!
Nice place
Perfect coffe
Great place
GREAT CAFE!
Cx
Wonderful breakfasts!!!! Very suitable for Israelis! There is also pita bread, an omelet with vegetables, a great salad, the coffee is excellent, fresh orange juice, really recommended😃

It is a cheap and simple cafe with a terrace seat and a Wi-Fi spot. The opening hours are a little short (until 6:00), there are times when there are no arrangements, and the cups are pure white, so it may not be for people who want to enjoy a cool cafe. By the way, even Small is a big size for Japanese people. The taste of coffee is slightly sour and light. The aftertaste is subtle because it is kept warm. Credit cards are also accepted.
What we liked the most was that we were the only tourists in the place, an authentic cafeteria with delicious dishes, we went back several days, having breakfast was a pleasure.
Really good place, the food is amazing and made to order, fresh & excellent service, great coffee. Good atmosphere, amazing food, good coffee and warm and considerate service. 5/5
It is a typical cafe in the city, the attention is spectacular and the coffee and the Frittatas are delicious!!

I ordered a Mediterranean plate and was disappointed. The hummus didn't taste like chickpeas or sesame, the falafels were pretty average, and I didn't like the grape leaves at all. The donut for dessert didn't save this meal.
The best evening in a long time, the food is super delicious, and the atmosphere is very pleasant.
Nice place 50 meters from pier 39. A good alternative to the touristy places in the port. Very good salads for lunchtime and very good attention.
very nice location for breakfast, partly with sunny spots in front of the door. Pier 39 is an 8-minute walk away.
A place frequented by locals a priori. Very good meal/coffee, very pleasant room, exotic
Very good . I took the Francisco salad at 8.95 dollars. Salads and sandwiches are made on site.
If you are looking for a nice, cheap place with good service, this is the right place. A place to return to when I return to San Francisco!
comfortable atmosphere quiet street It will remain as a good memory
Nice little cafe with happy hour from 2pm to 6pm beer only $3.50!!!
Super nice, delicious coffee and cake! Free wifi 😊
Very dirty
Tea
excellent breakfasts
It was great👍
Super nice little cafe
